q: phones. That brings the scandal that much closer to execs like Andy Coulson and now- Wall Street Journal head Les Hinton . Brian Cathcart on what this mean( h/t Jack Shafer ): The phone hacking scandal has entered a new phase and a number of very powerful people, up to and including David Cameron and Rupert Murdoch , should now be very worried. Glenn Mulcaire 's reported confirmation that a senior News of the World news editor, Ian Edmonson, commissioned him to hack phones elevates a nagging problem into a national political crisis. The problem is most acute at the Rupert Murdoch press, which must now defend itself against the charge that its staff hacked phones with the blessing of management. It also has to explain why it has

choke him-- she was clearly trying to hug him." She managed to touch his wrist, watch, and ring. "It was such a moment," Kirsten Gillibrand said. And we were just in tears of joy watching this and beyond ourselves, honestly. The doctor was just so excited. He said, "You don't understand, this is amazing, what's she's doing right now, and beyond our greatest hopes.' . By the way, to those that think it doesn't matter, it may not matter to us, but it certainly matters to most people. Consider that if Colin Powell had said something like: I was an officer for 25 years and I have seen good commanders and bad- and Barack Obama is in no way qualified to be running our military in this trying time- and McCain has all of the experience. Don't tell me that wouldn't have hurt Barack Obama - BIG TIME. 22 posted on 01/23/2011 7:49:25 AM PST I'm committed to not giving a damn what this pompous elitist thinks. IMHO

( AFP)- Cuban dissident Guillermo Farinas, the 2010 Sakharov rights prize winner, has been arrested and police are holding him in the central city of Santa Clara, his mother and dissidents said. I spoke with him, and he told me that he is under arrest in the third police unit in Santa Clara, and then he hung up, his mother Alicia Hernandez said by phone from the city located some 240 kilometers( 150 miles) east of Havana.
